meanings.definition: A sound of disgust or disapproval.
meanings.sent1: The loud blech from the audience showed their disapproval of the performance.
meanings.sent2: I heard a blech from the back of the room when I mentioned the upcoming test.
meanings.sent3: The blech from the toddler when offered broccoli was quite dramatic.
meanings.sent4: The blech of the car engine signaled that it was time for a trip to the mechanic.
meanings.sent5: The blech of the old door hinges made the whole house feel eerie.

meanings.definition: A metal tray used for cooking or serving food.
meanings.sent1: The chef placed the freshly baked cookies on the blech to cool down.
meanings.sent2: The caterer carried the blech filled with appetizers to the buffet table.
meanings.sent3: The blech gleamed under the kitchen lights, ready for the holiday feast.
meanings.sent4: The blech reflected the warm glow of the candles, creating a cozy atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The blech clattered as it was set down, announcing the start of the meal.

meanings.definition: A feeling of nausea or revulsion.
meanings.sent1: The sight of the moldy bread gave me a sudden blech in my stomach.
meanings.sent2: The smell of the garbage made me wrinkle my nose in blech.
meanings.sent3: The taste of the expired milk left a lingering blech in my mouth.
meanings.sent4: The horror movie filled me with a sense of blech that lasted all night.
meanings.sent5: The slimy texture of the overcooked pasta made me shudder in blech.
